description: This course provides an overview and analysis of Japan's economic development, beginning with
a review of the foundations for growth in the 19th century and focusing on the era of rapid growth
in the post WWII period. Students investigate the interaction of culture and the economy, Japan's
corporate capitalism, the "economic miracle," Japan-U.S. relations and prospects for future growth.
Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-121 or permission of instructor.  Offered alternate years.
